articles.description: Rishabh Pant hits a brilliant 61 but Scott Boland takes 4-42 as India lead Australia by 145 with four wickets left after day two.
articles.title: Australia v India: Rishabh Pant hits 61 but Test finely poised

articles.description: Why Luke Littler's historic world title win at Ally Pally felt 'inevitable', even if it wasn't.
articles.title: Luke Littler's world darts title win at Ally Pally felt 'inevitable', even if it wasn't

articles.description: Luke Littler has become darts' youngest world champion. BBC Sport looks at the qualities that have taken him to the top.
articles.title: Luke Littler: the mind and the making of darts' youngest world champion

articles.description: World number six Elena Rybakina's former coach Stefano Vukov is suspended by the WTA as an investigation into his behaviour towards the player continues.
articles.title: Elena Rybakina's ex-coach Stefano Vukov suspended as WTA investigation continues

articles.description: Former Masters champion Hideki Matsuyama has a one-stroke lead at the halfway point of The Sentry in Hawaii.
articles.title: The Sentry: Hideki Matsuyama leads PGA Tour opener in Hawaii

articles.description: Tottenham have signed Denmark midfielder Olivia Holdt on a contract running until June 2027.
articles.title: Tottenham sign Denmark midfielder Olivia Holdt from FC Rosengard

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on The Zutons frontman Dave McCabe with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.
articles.title: Premier League predictions: Chris Sutton v The Zutons frontman Dave McCabe

articles.description: United States Olympic sprinter Fred Kerley is tasered and arrested by police following a confrontation with officers in Miami, Florida.
articles.title: Fred Kerley: US Olympic sprinter tasered after police confrontation

articles.description: Liverpool reject two bids for Ben Doak, Arsenal want Matheus Cunha, Manchester City eye Lens defender Abdukodir Khusanov, plus more.
articles.title: Football gossip: Doak, Cunha, Chukwuemeka, Lewis-Potter

articles.description: Former Liverpool and Manchester United striker Michael Owen talks to BBC Sport's Dion Dublin about the rivalry between the two clubs and what it is like to have a foot in both camps.
articles.title: I didn't like playing against Liverpool for Man Utd - Owen
